summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Dues Reminders feature. Backend: 10/10 tests passed (6 skipped due to no non-authorized credentials). Frontend: All UI elements working correctly - templates list, editor, status cards, unpaid members table, and menu navigation.

minor.issue: Could not test 403 responses for non-authorized users - the 'admin' user provided is actually National SEC with full access. Need credentials for a non-National or non-Prez/VP/SEC/T user to test permission denial.

passed_tests: Backend: Admin login (Lonestar) successful
Backend: GET /api/dues-reminders/templates returns 3 templates with day triggers 3, 8, 10
Backend: Templates have correct structure (id, name, day_trigger, subject, body, is_active)
Backend: GET /api/dues-reminders/templates without auth returns 401/403
Backend: PUT /api/dues-reminders/templates/{id} updates template successfully
Backend: PUT /api/dues-reminders/templates/nonexistent returns 404
Backend: GET /api/dues-reminders/status returns expected fields (current_month, day_of_month, unpaid_count, suspended_count, unpaid_members)
Backend: Status unpaid_members list has correct structure (id, handle, name, email, chapter, reminders_sent)
Backend: POST /api/dues-reminders/run-check processes unpaid members and returns emails_sent count
Backend: POST /api/dues-reminders/send-test generates email preview with correct structure
Backend: POST /api/dues-reminders/send-test with nonexistent template returns 404
Frontend: Login and navigation to Dues Reminders page works
Frontend: Page header 'Dues Reminders' displayed
Frontend: Status cards show Current Month (Jan 2026), Unpaid Members (20), Suspended (20), Day of Month (11)
Frontend: Email Templates section shows 3 templates (Day 3, Day 8, Day 10)
Frontend: Run Check Now button present and functional
Frontend: Template selection highlights selected template
Frontend: Template editor shows Subject Line input, Email Body textarea, Active switch
Frontend: Save Template and Send Test buttons present
Frontend: Send Test dialog opens with email input and Preview Email button
Frontend: Unpaid Members table shows member handle, name, chapter, email, reminders sent badges
Frontend: Menu navigation shows Dues Reminders link for National SEC user
critical_code_review_comments: Email sending is MOCKED - emails are logged to console and recorded in dues_reminder_sent collection, not actually sent via SMTP
The 'admin' user provided in test credentials is actually National SEC with full access - need different credentials to test permission denial

test_credentials.note: The 'admin' user is also National SEC with full access

seed_data_creation: None - used existing production data. 3 email templates seeded on startup.
context_for_next_testing_agent: Dues Reminders feature is fully functional. Backend endpoints: GET/PUT templates, GET status, POST run-check, POST send-test. Frontend page at /dues-reminders with template editor, status cards, and unpaid members table. Email sending is MOCKED (logged, not sent). Menu shows Dues Reminders link for National Prez/VP/SEC/T users only. Currently 20 unpaid members for Jan 2026, all have received Day 10 reminders.
